text:
● My wife and myself walked from Block 55/56 Commonwealth Avenue side (Tanglin Halt) & cut across the old railway tracks.

🟧 We climbed the Wessex Village hills, and got down to Portsdown Road.

🟢 It was quite a long walk, but it was really fulfilling for us to see the old railway tracks, and as I walked past the old colonial Wessex Estate apartments, it made me feel nostalgic.

🌳🌳 My wife's childhood era
*************************
🔵  This area, Blk 55/56 ( Commonwealth Drive) and the Wessex Estate village area was where my wife used to roam about and play with her cousins.

🔵 My wife's late uncle used to live near Wessex Estate. ● My wife and her mum used to visit him several times a year and she would play by the railway tracks.

Pathway from 10 Woking Road, all the way down to Rail Corridor entrance at Commonwealth Drive.
Along the way, admire the Outdoor Art Installation titled Stagecraft: Landscaped Grounds by Artist Hilmi Johandi on display at the open field.

● We ( hubby and me) walked from Block
56 (Tanglin Halt area) and cut across the old KTM ( Keretapi Tanah Melayu) railway tracks.

🔵 After that, we climbed the Wessex Village hills, and walked down to Portsdown Road.

🟢 The walk was a moderate one. 🟧 It wasn't too difficult, and I was delighted to see the old railway tracks, and as I walked past the old colonial Wessex Estate apartments, it made me feel nostalgic.

✅️ Childhood days.
***********************
🟫 This area, Blk 55/56 ( Commonwealth Drive) and the Wessex Estate village area was where I used to roam about and play with my younger cousins.

🔵 My mum's late elder brother ( we address him as Kau Foo, a Cantonese term for maternal "Uncle") used to live at Tanglin Halt.

● In the 1970s, we would visit my uncle several times a year when I was a child, and I would play next to the railway tracks by myself.
